src_text: Phethagat o ya Mananeo a Mmu o Kabinete e thekga boikgafo bjo bo dirilwego ke Ditekanyet o t a Boset haba t a 2017 bja go t wet a pele pheto o ya motheo ya ekonomi ya set haba le go tsenya maAfrika Borwa a mant i ka ekonoming ka nepo ya gore go be le kgolo ye e akaret ago mang le man Mo lebakeng le ditekanyet o di lemoga gore kgolo ye e hlokago phetogo e tla maatlafat a leswa mekgwa ya tlhokego ya tekatekano ya nakong ye e fetilegPeakanyoleswa ka go thekga thuto, ditirelo t a maphelo le me omo ya mebasepala ka dinagamagaeng e t wela pele go ba selo se bohlokwa sa mananeo ao re
trg_text: safety ne Cabinet approved the report on the Implementation Evaluation of the Funza Lushaka Bursary Programme as well as the Management Response and Improvement from the Department of Basic Educatio This was part of the 2014/15 National Evaluation PlaCabinet approved that the Department of Basic Education retains the Programme which was established in 2007 to increase the supply of competent teachers specialising in priority area The Department will also consider the expansion and supplementation of the ProgrammEmpirical evidence shows that the design of the Programme is relevant in terms of its political, economic and social contex It is also largely appropriate in terms of the complex environment in which it is implemente The Programme has implemented continuous improvements in its strategy, including the introduction of a district-based recruitment system in 2012.

trg_text: Cabinet approved for the International Arbitration Bill to be introduced into Parliamen The aim of the Bill is to improve access to justice services and to ensure the realisation of the National Development Plan target of expanding trade and investment and positioning South Africa in the worlThe Bill incorporates the Model Law on International Commercial Arbitration, as adopted by the United Nations Commission on International Trade La

src_text: oma gabotse ga t homi o ya t helete ya set haba ebile di bulela dikgwebopotlana dibaka t a gore di kgathe tema ka ekonominDikabo t a ditekanyet o di thekga kgolo ya ekonomi le tlhabolllo: Rpilione e abet we dikgwebopotlana, dikgwebo t a magareng le dikgwebo t e nnyane (di-SMME), le dikgwebo t a mohlakanelwa; Rpilione e abet we mananeokgoparara a diintasteri ka mafelong ao a kgethegilego a ekonomi le ka mafelong ao a nago le diintasteri t e nt i; Rpilione e abet we go tsenywa tiri ong ga protepente, Rpilione ke ya Lekgotla la Dinyaki i o t a Mahlale le Diintasteri, t helete ya tlalelet o ye e ka bago R494 milione ke ya t wet opele ya boeti, t helete ye nngwe ya tlalelet o ye e ka bago R266 milione ke ya go thekga lefapha la diphedi t a ka meetseng le go fihlelela dinepo t a Ekonomi ya Lewatle ya Operation Phakisa, le go
trg_text: Implementation of Government Programmes Cabinet supports the commitments made in the 2017 National Budget to advance radical economic transformation and draw more South Africans into the economy towards inclusive growt In the main the budget acknowledges that growth without transformation would only reinforce the inequitable patterns from the pasRedistribution in support of education, health services and municipal functions in rural areas remains the central thrust of our spending programme Procurement reforms continue to improve the effectiveness of public spending and opening opportunities for small business participatioBudget allocations support economic growth and development: Rbillion for small, medium and micro enterprises and cooperatives; Rbillion for industrial infrastructure in special economic zones and industrial parks; Rbillion for broadband implementation, Rbillion for the Council for Scientific and Industrial Research, an additional R494 million for tourism promotion, an additional R266m to support the aquaculture sector and realise the goals of the Oceans Economy Phakisa Operation, and spending on agriculture, rural development and land reform amounting to nearly R30 billion by 2019/20.The budget plays a central role in transformation by promoting redistribution and directing scarce resources towards catalytic investments in human and physical capita In recognition of our need to invest in the future of youth, the budget ensures that financially needy students can access tertiary educatio The National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) has provided funding to over 300 000 new and returning students to study at universities and Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) colleges across the country in 2017.

src_text: omi a t helete go t a temo, tlhabollo ya dinagamagae le peakanyoleswa ya naga yeo e fihlago go R30 pilione ka 2019/20.Ditekanyet o t e di raloka tema ye bohlokwa ka pheto ong ka go t wet a pele go phatlalat a leswa le go lebi a methopo ye e hlokagalago go dipeelet o t e bohlokwa ka go bokgoni bja ba omi le bja ditlabelo t a mo om Ka temogong ya nyakego ya gore re beelet e ka go bokamoso bja bafsa, ditekanyet o t e di netefat a gore baithuti bao ba hlokago ba kgona go fihlelela thuto ya godingwan Setlamo sa Boset haba sa Thu o ya Dit helete t a Baithuti (NSFAS) se file baithuti ba baswa le ba kgale bao ba fetago ba 300 000 dit helete t a go ithuta ka diyunibesithing le ka dikholet heng t a Thuto le Tlhahlo t a Sethekniki le t a Diatla (TVET) go ralala le naga ka 2017.Sekhwama se se emet e go oket a ka palo ya baithuti ba 100 000 mo ngwageng w T helete ye e ka bago R15 pilione ye e abet wego NSFAS ke mmu o e tla thu a go fedi a boima bja mabapi le dit helete bjo baithuti bao ba hlokago le bao ba t wago malapeng a magareng ba bego ba lebane le bjon Go latela go tsebagat a semmu o ka katlego ga Operation Phakisa ka mafapheng a go swana le la Ekonomi ya Lewatle, la Maphelo le la Thuto ya Motheo, Mopresidente Jacob Zuma o tsebagadit e semmu o Operation Phakisa ya Temo, Peakanyoleswa ya Naga le Tlhabollo ya Dinagamagae ka la 24 Dibokwane 2017.Operation Phakisa e t wa go mokgwa wa Malaysia wa Khwet o ya Dipoelo t e Kgolo ka Pela wo o
trg_text: Cabinet approved submission of the 1st Quadrennial Country Report on the 2005 Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions, to UNESCThe Convention recognises that cultural goods and services convey identity, values and meanin Culture has the potential to become one of the strongest contributors to the economy, to social cohesion and to poverty alleviatioSuccess indicators are the adoption of four complementary strategies: The Mzansi Golden Economy Strategy; the Social Cohesion Strategy; the National Development Plan and the New Growth Path Strategy; and fully established Department of Arts and Culture agencies with Board South Africa has also made substantive progress in recognising the importance of indigenous languages in policy and legislation Bills Cabinet approved the National Public Health Institutes of South Africa Bill for tabling in Parliamen It provides for the establishment of the National Public Health Institutes of South Africa (NAPHISA), its functions, powers and dutieNAPHISA aims to provide integrated and coordinated disease and injury surveillance, research, monitoring and evaluation of services and intervention directed towards the major public health problems affecting persons in South Afric This will increase the capacity to monitor communicable, non-communicable diseases and injuries, which will aid in the early detection, prevention, and response to these condition This will ultimately contribute to the control of diseases and reduction of morbidity and mortalitNAPHISA will be a national resource that serves public health interest and is intended to provide for a system of health protection that focuses on access, equity, efficiency and qualit Cabinet approved for the National Health Laboratory Service Amendment Bill to be tabled in Parliamen This amends the National Health Laboratory Service Act, 2000 (Act No 37 of 2000).The proposed amendments seek to improve the governance, accountability, and financial sustainability of the National Health Laboratory Servic This will enable the national service to provide diagnostic health laboratory services more cost effectively and with greater efficiency, so as to increase the quality of clinical care provided to patients through timely and judicious clinical managemen Cabinet approved that the Older Persons Amendment Bill, 2016 be published for public commen The Bill amends the Older Persons Act 13 of 2006.

src_text: omi it wego go fihlelela pheto o ya motheo ya ekonomi ya set haba; le ka ge e beakant we gore e swanele maemo a ka Afrika Borwa, bjale e bopa karolo ya setlabelo sa rena sa phethagat o ya Leano la Dintlha t a SenyanOperation Phakisa ya Temo, Peakanyoleswa ya Naga le Tlhabollo ya Dinagamagae e nyaka go fihlelela kgolo ye e amago mang le mang, ka ge e hlagi wa ke nepo ya Leanotlhabollo la Boset haba (NDP) ebile e ikemi edit e go tsenya letsogo ka go hlohlelet eng ga kgolo ya ekonomi, go hlohlelet a tlhomo ya me omo, le go feto a lenaneokabo la t a tem E t wela pele go nyaka go netefat a gore go ba le phihlelelo ye e lekanego go naga, bobedi ka nepo ya go hlabolla ekonomi le pheto o ya t a temLenaneo le le tla lekodi i a mekgwa ya bjale ya thekgo ya bat welet i le go t welet a mekgwa ya thekgo ya ma eleng ye e ikemi edit ego go akgofi a peakanyoleswa ya naga, ka lebaka la ge go na le tlhokego ya t hoganet o ya gore mmu o o be le kgatelopele ka go t welet o e sa hlaelego ya dij Godimo ga fao, lenaneo le le nyaka go rarolla mathata ka nepo ya go netefat a gore go be le phihlelelo ye e lekalekanago go naga, bobedi ka nepo ya go hlabolla ekonomi le pheto o ya t a tem Se se akaret a peakanyoleswa ya naga, tlhabollo ya dinagamagae, tlhabollo ya ba omi, ya maroro, ya diruiwa, go lema ka dirapaneng le thekgo ya bat welet
trg_text: Operation Phakisa is derived from Malaysia s Big Fast Results methodology which Malaysia used successfully to achieve rapid economic transformation; and having been successfully adapted to South African conditions, it now forms part of our Nine Point Plan Implementation toolkiOperation Phakisa for Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Development seeks to achieve inclusive growth, as prescribed by the vision of the NDP and aims at contributing to stimulating economic growth, fostering job creation, and transforming the agricultural value chai It further seeks to ensure equitable access to land, both towards economic development and agrarian transformatioThe programme will review existing producer support models and develop finance models aimed at fast tracking land reform, given the urgent need for government to make progress in food securit Furthermore, the programme seeks to address constraints in ensuring equitable access to land, both towards economic development and agrarian transformatio These include land reform, rural development, labour, grains, livestock, horticulture and producer suppor In 2016, over 10 million tourist arrivals were recorded in South Africa, a 13 per cent increase from 2015.

src_text: Ka 2016, go begilwe gore go gorogile baeti ba go feta ba 10 milione ka Afrika Borwa, e lego koket ego ya 13% go tloga ka 2015.
trg_text: President Jacob Zuma will deliver his annual address to the National House of Traditional Leaders on 3 March 2017.Emanating from the Address a Programme of Action will be developed and implemented by the House and the Department of Traditional Affair The official opening of the house will also celebrate 20 years since it was constitute.

src_text: Intasteri ya rena ya t a boeti ye e atlegago ke taet o ya tiri anommogo gareng ga mmu o, mekgatlo ya ba omi le dikgwebo gome di etilwe pele ke Kgoro ya Boeti gammogo le Tirelo ya Boeti ya Afrika Borwa ka nepo ya go lokolla dikholego ka botlalo t a mothopo wa rena wa t a boet Re ipilet a go badiri ani ka moka ba ka mo intastering ye go t wela pele go hlabolla le go t wet a pele boeti gore bo kgone go hola dit haba ka me omo le ka tlhabollo ya mananeokgoparar Bjalo ka karolo ya nepi o ya Mmu o ya go lokolla bokgoni bja di-SMME le dikgwebo t a makhei eneng, Afrika Borwa e tla ba monggae wa Khonkrese ya Lefase ka Bophara ya Bohlomikgwebo gareng ga la 13 le la 16 Hlakola 2017 ka Johannesbur Khonkrese ke kopano ya mafapha a mehutahuta ya bahlomi ba kgwebo bao ba sa thomago yeo e gokedit ego baromiwa ba 4 000 go t wa ka dinageng t e di fetago t e 150.Baetapele bao ba nago le tsebo, bahlomi ba dikgwebo, babeelet i, banyaki i i le bahlami ba melao bao ba fetogilego karolo ya lesolo la lefase ka bophara leo le t wet ago pele bohlomikgwebo bjalo ka mokgwa wa go aga diekonomi le go kaonafat a maemo a batho, ba tla tsenela khonkrese ySe ke la mathomo khonkrese ye e swarelwa ka Afrika gomme e fa Afrika Borwa le khonthinente ka bophara sebaka sa go hlohlelet a moya wa yona wa bohlomi bja dikgweb Afrika Borwa e ketekile go thoma ga Kgwedi ya Ditokelo t a Botho ka la 1 Hlakola 2017 ka fase ga morero wa:
trg_text: Our thriving tourism industry is testament to the close collaboration between government, organised labour and business led by the Department of Tourism together with South African Tourism to unlock the full economic benefits of our tourism asset We call on all industry partners to continue developing and promoting tourism so that it may benefit local communities through jobs and infrastructure developmen As part of Government focus to unlock the potential of SMME s and township enterprises, South Africa will host the Global Entrepreneurship Congress between the 13 and16 March 2017 in Johannesbur The congress is an inter-disciplinary gathering of start-up champions that attracts 4 000 delegates from more than 150 countrie

trg_text: Waste Water the untapped resource .President Jacob Zuma who is a member of the United Nations High Level Panel on Water Action Plan will open the event, by launching the World Water Development Report 2017 on wastewater and related activitie Cabinet welcomes the progress made on the distribution of animal feeds to support farmers in the country s drought affected area The initiative is part of the R212 million in support, which government has made available in 2016/17 to assist affected farmers across the countrProvinces have also made R198 million available through equitable share funding, and funds from the Prevention and Mitigation of Disaster Risk programme were used to drill boreholes and construct fire break.

trg_text: As is the case of the annual crime report, this report will cover the provincial and national incidence of crim The crime statistics are generated from crime data recorded at station leveThe quarterly releases will enable government to monitor key targets, in particular the reduction of reported serious crimes, as set out in the Medium Term Strategic Framework and could also be utilised as early warning to strengthen the crime prevention operations and strategies of Governmen.

src_text: Ka nepo ya go thu a ka mathateng a mabapi le go hwet agala ga meetse ka Kapa Bodikela, go swanet e go hlongwa maitekelo a go aba kimolo ye kgolo ka mokgwa wa kabo ya methopo ya meetse ya boikgethelo yeo e swanet ego go ba komana madula a bapile ge go ka hwet wa meetse ao a sego a lekana mo sehleng sGo t wela pele go ilet a t homi o ya meetse go feti i a, Kgoro ya Meetse le Kelelat hila e tsebi it e lefapha la temo ka ga 10% ya tlalelet o go dikilet o t a t homi o ya meets Dikilet o t a t homi o ya meetse di tla dula di le ka tsela yeo go fihla ge matamo a tlala go fihla go 85% ya mothamo wa on.
trg_text: In order to assist with the difficulties with regard to water availability in the Western Cape, attempts need to be instituted to provide greater comfort in the form of additional alternate water supply sources that must be on standby should inadequate water be received for this seasoTo further curb excessive water use, the Department of Water and Sanitation has informed the agricultural sector of 10% additional water restriction

src_text: Ge naga e amogela dipula t e di hlokagalago kudu t eo di tlago thu a kudu go imolla naga go diabe t a komelelo, matamo le dinoka di bont ha maswao a methamo ye e hlatlogag Kgonagalo ya mafula e sa le godim Re ipilet a go dit haba go nt ha maahlo dinameng ka go hlokomela mafula ao a ka felet ago ka tahlego ya maphelo, ka tshenyo ya thoto le ya mananeokgoparar Mmu o le ditheo t a ona di hlokomet e seemo se ka mafolofolo gomme di lokile go ka t ea magato fao go hlokegag.
trg_text: As the country welcomes the much needed rains which will go a long way in relieving the country from the effects of drought, dams and rivers are showing signs of increasing volume The possibility of flash flooding remains hig We call on communities to remain vigilant of flash flooding which could lead to the loss of life, destruction to property and infrastructur Government and its agencies are actively monitoring the situation and are ready to act where necessar.

trg_text: President Jacob Zuma will lead a South African government delegation to the SADC Extraordinary Summit on 18 March 2017, in the Kingdom of Swazilan SADC continues to serve as the primary vehicle for South Africa s foreign policy to achieve regional development and integration within our regioIt is expected that the Summit will deliberate on, amongst other things, the state of peace and security in the region, with particular focus on the developments in the Kingdom of Lesotho and the Democratic Republic of Congo and the implementation of the Revised Regional Indicative Strategic PlaSouth Africa as the incoming Chair of SADC is scheduled to host the next SADC Ordinary Summit in August 20114.

trg_text: On 8 March President Jacob Zuma will undertake an official State Visit to Indonesi Both South Africa and Indonesia are one of the largest economies in their respective regions, and endowed with rich natural and maritime resource.

src_text: oma bjalo ka sediri wa se bohlokwa sa molaotshepet o wa Afrika Borwa mabapi le dinaga t a ka ntle ka nepo ya go fihlelela tlhabollo ya dilete le kopanyo ya ka seleteng sa renGo emet we gore seboka se se tla reri ana ka ga, gareng ga t e dingwe, seemo sa khut o le t hirelet ego ka seleteng se, gomme go lebelet we kudu ditiragalo t a moragorago t a ka Nageng ya Bogo i ya Lesotho le ka Democratic Republic of Congo le go tsenywa tiri ong ga Leanotogamaano la Taet o la ka Seleteng leo le Bu eledit wegAfrika Borwa bjalo ka Modulasetulo yo a tsenago wa SADC go rulagant we gore e tla ba monggae wa Seboka sa Mehleng se se latelago sa SADC ka Phato 20114.

commemoration of the sinking of the SS Mendi which was held in the United Kingdom respectivel Cabinet honours and remembers members of the South African Native Labour Corps who lost their lives during the worst ever maritime accident in the military history of South Afric These were brave men who had responded to a call by the Imperial power at that time to serv Following the positive identification of the Fall Army Worm infestation, government led by the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries is continuing with the assessment of spread and damage, as well as awareness actions to provide farmers with accurate technical information and control options as well as to ensure the responsible emergency registration of agricultural chemicalThe department has also initiated a pest action group, which meets regularly to evaluate progress and results with all provincial departments of agriculture, industry members and research organisation The South African Emergency Plant Pest Response Plan, which deals with new pest detections, is already in motion to fight Fall Army Wor Government will continue with its engagement with the Southern African Development Community to ensure that early warnings of these biological threats are in plac Cabinet wishes commuters who were injured when two trains collided at the Rosslyn train station north of Pretoria a speedy recovery and conveys its gratitude to emergency services for their quick response in assisting the injure The work by the board of inquiry in conducting a comprehensive investigation into the cause of the accident and circumstances around it must be prioritised in order to prevent future occurrences Condolences and Sympathy Cabinet joins President Jacob Zuma in conveying its condolences to the family of Judge Essa Moosa, who was a shining light of the judiciary who served South Africa with distinction before retiring as a judge of the Western Cape High Court in 2011.

src_text: Ka la 8 Hlakola Mopresidente Jacob Zuma o tla tsenela Ketelo ya Semmu o ka Indonesi Bobedi Afrika Borwa le Indonesia ke t e dingwe t a diekonomi t e kgolo kudu ka dileteng t a t ona, gomme di humile ka methopo ya diminerale le ya diphedi t a ka meetsen.
trg_text: This will be preceded by the Leaders' Summit of the Indian Ocean RIM Association (IORA) from 6 to 7 March 2017, which will also commemorate IORA's 20th anniversar At that Summit, President Widodo will hand over the chairship of IORA to South AfricSouth Africa and Indonesia are both founding members of IORA, which comprises 21 coastal states of the Indian Ocea South Africa served as Vice Chair from 2015 to early 2017 and will serve as Chair from 2017 to 201 Cabinet decisions Cabinet approved the gazetting of the draft Mine Water Management Policy for public commen Mine Water Management, including Acid Mine Drainage, remains a major environmental challengThe Policy provides the basis for holding parties potentially liable for negative effects and damages of Acid Mine Drainage related pollution and/or any other negative impacts that can be related to i The policy also seeks to propose mechanisms that mining houses should explore to better manage their wate Cabinet was briefed on the progress report of the Inter-Ministerial Committee for the Revitalisation of Distressed Mining Communities

src_text: oma bjalo ka Modulasetulo go tloga ka 2017 go fihla ka 201 Diphetho t a Kabinete Kabinete e dumelet e go tsenywa ka kuranteng ya mmu o ga sethalwa sa Molaotshepet o wa Taolo ya Meetse a Meepo gore set haba se fe ditshwaotshwao ka ga son Taolo ya Meetse a Meepo, go akaret wa Kelelat hila ya Diesiti t a ka Meepong, e t wela pele go ba bothata bjo bogolo bja tikologMolaotshepet o wo o fa motheo wa go rwe a bao ba amegago maikarabelo mabapi le diabe t e di sego t a loka le ditshenyo t e di dirwago ke Kelelat hila ya Diela t a Esiti ya Meepo t eo di amanago le t hilafat o le/goba diabe dife goba dife t a go se loke t eo di ka amanago le yon Molaotshepet o wo gape o nyaka go
trg_text: Cabinet was briefed on the Minister of Police s intention to declare an amnesty in terms of the Firearms Control Act, 2000 (Act No 60 of 2000), for a period of six months to maximise the participation of the community, and will commence on 1 April 2017 and end on 30 September 2017.The amnesty will reduce the circulation of illegally possessed firearms which will in turn result in the reduction of contact crimeThe amnesty will focus on the following holders of firearms and/or ammunition in South Africa:a) Persons in possession of illegal firearms and/or ammunition in circulation, including those involved in one or more criminal activities; andb) Persons who inherited firearms and/ or ammunition and failed to comply with the provisions of the Firearms Controls Ac.

trg_text: implementation of relevant findings from its Australian Mining Industry Benchmarking Study tour of 24 to 28 August 2015.The study tour was premised on the Rapid Appraisal of the Policy and Regulatory Systems Governing the Mining Sector which compared the policy and legislative frameworks governing the mining sector as well as the practices of mining companies in Australia, Chile, South Africa and ZambiHighlights of progress include partnerships between government and mining companies in delivering decent housing and living conditions for mine workers and community members; A review of mining companies water treatment plants is being conducted to assess the possibility of infrastructure partnership The development of mining towns spatial transformation plans has been finalised for five municipalitie Catalytic economic development projects are being implemented in labour sending areas, with an emphasis on the advancement of the agriculture sector in mining communities; and fast tracking of increased access to medical assessments for ex-mineworkers, community members and current mineworkerCabinet approved for the Departments of Labour and Mineral Resources to study the different Australian mine commuting models to assist long haul South African migrant mineworkers to commute home more frequentlCabinet also approved for the Department of Health work closely with the Department of Mineral Resources and other partners in the provision of supportive services to ex-mineworkers in dealing with occupational diseases, with a view to reducing and preventing mine related occupational health challengeA request was made for the Department of Human Settlements to fast track the implementation of integrated human settlements projects in collaboration with mining companie Cabinet approved the improvement plan based on the findings and recommendations of the synthesis evaluation of whether the provision of state subsidised housing has addressed asset poverty for households and local municipalitieOver 3 million houses have been provided through the government housing programm million of the houses are delivered through the capital subsidy which confers individual ownership of a free standing house to households earning less than R3500 per mont Evidence affirms housing as an important component of the social wage package and households

trg_text: Cabinet approved the National Anti-gangsterism Strategy to address gangsterism in all its manifestations by way of an all-government approac This is aligned to the National Development Plan to ensure that people living in South Africa feel safe at home, schools and work, and enjoy community life free of fea This also recognises that crime and violence are not just a security issue, but have deep social and economic roots and consequence.

trg_text: The overarching outcome is delivery of responsive and quality developmental social services, through the regulation of social service practitioner This creates an enabling framework that will broaden the human resource profile of the social development sector, so as to improve the care and protection services provided to vulnerable groupThere is a need for a diverse cadres of social service practitioners including community development practitioner, care givers, and Early Childhood Development practitioners; to respond to legislative reforms, the changing needs of communities, and socio-economic conditions in the social welfare services secto Cabinet approved The Directive on the Determination of other Categories of Designated Employees Required to Disclose Their Financial Interests, which will be implemented with effect from 1 April 2017.The risks to good governance arising from conflict of interest situations do not only face employees in senior management position The eDisclosure system is being reconfigured to enable other categories of employees to disclose their financial interests on-line and for the verification process to take place at the departmental leve Cabinet approved South Africa s Phase 3 Written Follow-up Country Report regarding the implementation of the OECD Convention on Combating Bribery and Foreign Public Officials in International Business Transactions (Anti-Bribery Convention).The report outlines the concerted efforts of government to detect, investigate and prosecute foreign bribery case This Convention focuses on the use of domestic law to criminalise bribery of foreign official It applies to active and passive bribery, but excludes bribery that is purely domestic and bribery where the direct or indirect recipient of a benefit is not a public officiaPhase 1 focussed on identification of legal instruments and mechanisms that countries have adopted to combat foreign briber Phase 2 focussed on the application and effectiveness of such instruments and mechanism Phase 3 sought to determine the impact of the country s adoption of the Conventio Phase 4, which commenced in 2016, is focussing on key group-wide cross-cutting issues related to enforcement efforts and changes in the domestic legislation or institutional framework of the Partie Cabinet approved the proposed measures set out in the Business Case to reposition the Department of Home Affair The Department must be positioned within the security system of the state so that it contributes to national security and is able to protect its people, systems and datThis will better enable the department to deliver against its full mandate as a critical enabler of inclusive economic development, national security, effective service delivery and efficient administratio.

src_text: Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga Tlhako ya Dipalopalo t a Bagolofadi gomme ya dumelela go lekwa ga Dipalopalo ka ga Tlhokego ya Tekatekano ya Bagolofad Kabinete gape e thekga karoganyo ya mmu o ka bophara ya magoro ka moka a tshedimo o a mabapi le bong, bogole le mengwagDipalopalo ka ga Tlhokego ya Tekatekano ya Bagolofadi ke setlabelo se bohlokwa sa go lati i a tlhokego ya tekatekano gareng ga bagolofadi le batho bao ba se nago le bogolofadi, gomme di fana ka tlhokomedi i o ya ka pela ya maemo a godimo ya togamaano ka ga kelo ya sekgoba sa tlhokego ya tekatekan Se se thu a ka go dira gore go tsena gare ga mmu o go akaret e bohlTshepedi o ya karoganyo e tla kgont ha diphetolo t a ka pela t eo di dirwago ke mmu o ka ga maitemogelo ao a lego gona go ba bant i bao ba lego kotsin Dipheto o t a melaotshepet o le dikaonafat o di nno i, di ka se fokot e tlhokego ye ya tekatekano, ka ntle le go diri a kelo ye e kwagalago le ye e swanago ya sekgoba ka ga tlhokego ya tekatekan Kabinete e dumelet e Molawana ka ga Ba omedi ba Ditirelo t a Set haba, wa 2016.

src_text: Dipoelo t a kakaret o ke kabo ya ditirelo t a leago t a tlhabollo t eo di arabelago le t a boleng, ka go laola ba omedi ba ditirelo t a set hab Se se hloma tikologo ye e kgont hago yeo e tlago katolo a seemo sa ba omi sa lefapha la tlhabollo ya leago, go realo e le go kaonafat a ditirelo t a tlhokomelo le t a t hirelet o t eo di abet wego dihlopha t eo di lego kotsinGo na le tlhokego ya ba omedii bao ba farologanego ba ditirelo t a leago go akaret wa ba omedi ba tlhabollo ya set haba, bahlokomedi ba bana, le ba omedi ba Dikolo t a Thuto ya Digotlane (ECD); go arabela dipheto o t eo di dirwago ke melao, ditlhokego t a mabapi le phetogo t a dit haba, le maemo a ekonomi ya set haba ka lefapheng la ditirelo t a leago t a mabapi le bobotlan Kabinete e dumelet e Taelo ka ga Sephetho sa Magoro a mangwe a Ba omi ba Me omo ye It ego gore ba Kgopelwa go Tsebagat a Dikgahlego t a Bona t a Dit helete, yeo e tlago tsenywa tiri ong go thoma ka la 1 Moranang 2017.Dikotsi go pu o ye kaone t eo di bakwago ke maemo a thulano ya dikgahlego ga di lebane le ba omi fela bao ba lego maemong a godingwana a bolaod Lenaneo la eDisclosure le beakanywa leswa ka nepo ya go kgont ha magoro a mangwe a ba omi go tsebagat wa dikgahlego t a bona t a dit helete inthaneteng le gore tshepedi o ya tii et o e direge ka dikgoron Kabinete e dumelet e Pego ya ka Nageng ya Tati i o ye e Ngwadilwego ya Kgato ya Boraro ya Afrika Borwa ya mabapi le go tsenywa tiri ong ga Kwano ya OECD ka ga go Lwant ha Tsogolekobong le Bahkankedi ba Mmu o ba Dinaga t e dingwe go Kgatha Tema ka Dikgwebi anong t a Dikgwebo t a Bodit habat haba (Kwano ka ga Twant ho ya Tsogolekobong).Pego ye e hlagi a maitapi o a maatla a mmu o a go utolla, a go nyaki i a le go seki a melato ya mabapi le ditiro t a tsogolekobong t eo di dirwago dinageng t a ka ntl Kwano ye e lebelet e kudu t homi o ya molao wa ka nageng go dira gore go reka bahlankedi ba dinaga t a ka ntle ka tsogolekobong e be bosenyE

trg_text: Cabinet approved South Africa s 3rd cycle Universal Periodic Review country report, to be presented for review by the Universal Periodic Review Working Group, at the United Nations (UN) Human Rights Council in May 2017.The report reflects on the progress made by South Africa in realising the human rights and fundamental freedoms contained in the ConstitutioThe Universal Periodic Review is a unique process which involves a review of human rights records of all 193 UN Member States once every four year It provides an opportunity for all States to declare what actions they have taken to improve the human rights situations in their countries and to overcome challenges to the enjoyment of human right It also includes a sharing of best human rights practices around the glob.

that older persons have access to quality services such as social, health, community based, and residential car Cabinet approved the publication of the Fund Raising Amendment Bill, 2016 for public commen Further, Cabinet approved for the repeal of the existing funds and the consolidation of their assets and liabilities to one Fun The Bill amends the Fund Raising Act, 1978 which is outdateThe Bill streamlines responses to disasters and allows for the deployment of risk mitigation and developmental strategies through the consolidation of the existing funds including their respective assets and liabilities into one National Social Development and Relief Fun The fund raising capabilities of the Act will be restored and the fund will not only be able to react when social relief is needed, Environmental Act, 1998 (Act N 107 of 1998) as well as a number of Specific Environmental Management ActThis will strengthen: integrated environmental management; one environmental management system; compliance and enforcement measures; biodiversity and conservation; air quality management; waste management; and integrated coastal managemen Cabinet approved for the Draft Regulation of Agricultural gives effect to the establishment of the Land Commission which will ensure a transparent and more conducive regulatory environment for the generation and utilisation of policy-relevant information on ownership and usage of agricultural lanThis will improve the state s ability to monitor and evaluate its compliance with the constitutional directive to ensure land tenure and related reforms, with the intent of taking measures to redress the results of past racial discriminatioThis contributes to the National Development Plan s vision for rural revitalisation, inclusive economic growth and Home Loan and Mortgage Disclosure Act, 2000 (Act N 63 of 2000).The Bill addresses human settlements challenges identified in the National Development Pla This includes: dysfunctional settlement patterns across the country; challenges facing towns and cities; weak spatial planning and governance capabilitieThe Bill seeks to provide for housing finance which is in line with section 26 of the
